sentences.en: ...a young couple locked in an embrace.
sentences.cn: …紧紧相拥的年轻一对。

sentences.en: Both parties must embrace the end objective.
sentences.cn: 双方必须拥护最后的目标.

sentences.en: Dorothea was altogether captivated by the wide embrace of this conception.
sentences.cn: 多萝西被这个范围广泛的伟大设想完全征服了.

sentences.en: Freddie greeted his brother with a warm embrace.
sentences.cn: 弗烈特用热情的拥抱欢迎他的弟弟.

sentences.en: He held her to him in a warm embrace.
sentences.cn: 他热列地拥抱她.

sentences.en: He was of a vast embrace.
sentences.cn: 他有最广博的爱.

sentences.en: I couldn't find it in me to embrace him.
sentences.cn: 我打心眼里不想拥抱他。

sentences.en: Jack warmly embraced his son.
sentences.cn: 杰克热情拥抱他的儿子。

sentences.en: John gently disengaged himself from his sister's tearful embrace.
sentences.cn: 约翰轻轻推开抱着他哭泣的妹妹。

sentences.en: Let us embrace lions also in the same view.
sentences.cn: 让咱们以同样的观点看待狮子吧.

sentences.en: Maggie and Laura embraced.
sentences.cn: 玛吉和劳拉拥抱在一起。

sentences.en: Most West European countries have embraced the concept of high-speed rail networks with enthusiasm.
sentences.cn: 大多数西欧国家都表现出极大的兴趣，欣然接受修建高速铁路网的想法。

sentences.en: She broke loose from his embrace and crossed to the window.
sentences.cn: 她从他怀抱里挣脱出来，走到窗前。

sentences.en: She held her son to her in an affectionate embrace.
sentences.cn: 她亲切地将她儿子搂在怀里.

sentences.en: She held out her arms to embrace the little girl.
sentences.cn: 她伸出双臂来拥抱那个小女孩.

sentences.en: The hills embrace the village.
sentences.cn: 山丘环绕着村庄.

sentences.en: The marriage signalled James's embrace of the Catholic faith.
sentences.cn: 这桩婚姻标志着詹姆斯皈依了天主教.

sentences.en: They'll be ready to embrace the new technology when it arrives.
sentences.cn: 他们随时准备迎接新技术的问世。

sentences.en: This course embraces several different aspects of psychology.
sentences.cn: 这门课程涉及心理学的几个不同方面。

sentences.en: To embrace her was like embracing a jointed wooden image.
sentences.cn: 若是拥抱她,那感觉活像拥抱一块木疙瘩.

sentences.en: We hope these regions will embrace democratic reforms.
sentences.cn: 我们希望这些地区会乐意接受民主改革。

words.tran_cn: 拥抱，包含（embrace的现在分词形式）

trans.tran_en: the act of holding someone close to you, especially as a sign of love

trans.tran_cn: 拥抱，欣然接受，信奉，包括
trans.tran_en: to put your arms around someone and hold them in a friendly or loving way
to put your arms around someone and hold them in a friendly or loving way

trans.tran_cn: 拥抱；包括，包含；包围，环绕；抓住，欣然接受；信奉
trans.tran_en: to put your arms around someone and hold them in a friendly or loving way
